alert.note: Alert for Northern Humboldt Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued December 26 at 2:24PM PST until December 27 at 11:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TO 11 PM PST TUESDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Large breaking waves from 22 to 26 feet. * WHERE...Northern Humboldt Coast County. * WHEN...From 6 AM to 11 PM PST Tuesday.. . * IMPACTS...Dangerous surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Beachcombing is highly discouraged!.
info.instruction: Large breaking waves along the coast will lead to increased wave run-up on beaches with waves topping and washing over large rocks and jetties. These large waves can be erratic and unpredictable. Use extra caution near the surf zone as these large waves will be capable of sweeping people into the frigid and turbulent ocean water. Mariners traversing the bar are urged to exercise extreme caution or stay in port until the threat subsides. Please contact the U.S. Coast Guard for information regarding harbor and bar closures.
